snippet: Mick Kelleher, the Yankees’ first-base coach, has compared Robinson Cano — and his balletic footwork, soft hands and long, smooth swing — to the tennis star Roger Federer.
abstract: Fluid and graceful swing of New York Yankees second baseman Robinson Cano has been compared to tennis stroke of champion Roger Federer.
lead_paragraph: Mick Kelleher, the Yankees’ first-base coach, has compared Robinson Cano — and his balletic footwork, soft hands and long, smooth swing — to the tennis star Roger Federer.

headline.seo: Swing of Yankees’ Cano Bears Resemblance to Federer’s
headline.main: A Graceful Swing That Bears Resemblance to Federer’s
headline.print_headline: The Success of Cano, Borne on a Swing As Sweet as Federer’s
